intro: Saxifraga balongshanensis, commonly known as the Balongshan saxifrage, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native habitat.
